title: Question 6
prompt: Which of the following is the best conclusion from this data?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

Pardosa milvina wolf spiders do not catch prey in webs. Instead, they hunt their prey, moving over stones or through grasses and plants. Researchers studying the Pardosa milvina wolf spider divided caged spiders into two groups, one that received constant food (high fed) and the other that received no food during the test (low fed). They gathered the following data about the spiders’ movement.
feedback: After 7 days without food, spiders showed a reduction in movement. After 14 days, the spiders’ movement was less than half of the fed spiders’ movement. A sustained, or constant, lack of food causes reduced movement in Pardosa milvina spiders.
